Description: Body of a pottery pyxis with a flaring rim, lid missing; the rim is chipped, and there are traces of a whitish deposit in places. Exterior: bands of orange-fired glaze frame hook-pattern frieze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.67)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: A1663 (Smith's unpublished catalogue number)
